top_categories.workout_context: 150 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Croatan Buck Fifty's croatan National Forest—flat coastal gravel, rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Croatan Buck Fifty's Croatan National Forest gravel (90%), Dirt roads (10%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 150 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Croatan Buck Fifty's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
150 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Croatan Buck Fifty. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 150 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,000ft of climbing on croatan National Forest—flat coastal gravel, does to your power file on race day.
At Croatan Buck Fifty, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Croatan Buck Fifty, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Tempo is Croatan Buck Fifty's race pace. The wattage you'll hold for 150 miles on croatan National Forest—flat coastal gravel,. Train it until it's automatic.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 150 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 150 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Croatan Buck Fifty requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on croatan national forest—flat coastal gravel, sandy terrain to build confidence. Expect: croatan national forest gravel (90%), dirt roads (10%), flat coastal terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 150 miles of croatan national forest—flat coastal gravel, sandy terrain in New Bern, North Carolina (Croatan National Forest).
